column4: guys iam trying to play this stream or lets listen to this station online and it aint opening up in amorok .. please coud you take a look and tell me if there is something i can do about it to listen here is the web site http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio1/innewmusicwetrust/petetong/
works fine for me
you need realplayer for linux
oh so i cant use it on amorok or anything else only realplayer ?
there you go
not sure about amarok
i use xmms for lots of stuff
nice music
cheers mate .. man too bad i cant listen to it :(
well, it's just a matter of installing realplay. wait up
ok the plug on or the whole p[rogram coz i dont want real player i want an alternative
http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Ubuntu_Edgy#How_to_install_Multimedia_Player_.28RealPlayer_10.29
need realplayer 10
and not realplayer 8
add this to your /etc/apt/sources.list at the bottom
deb http://archive.canonical.com/ubuntu edgy-commercial main
ok i will but whats that lines supposed to do ./
that will add the repository to download realplayer version 10 which is needed.
deb http://archive.canonical.com/ubuntu edgy-commercial main at the end of your /etc/apt/sources.list
then do "sudo apt-get update"
then do "sudo apt-get install realplay"
i dont want the porgram its self if i just get in the plug in thats fine
can i just get the plug in by adding teh link in my sources.list
there's a small library there that you copy to your browser's plugins dir
i don't think so
heh
man .. you use xmms right .. does it work with that and .. is it better than amorok ?
well, xmms is more sort of personal audio system. it's fast and very slick.
ok give me your email
i'll send you the plugin
the plug in for what ?
never mind. just install the realplay and then copy nphelix.so and nphelix.xpt in your browser's plugin and then you delete realplayer. how's that ?
sounds great buuut .. i dunno how to do that :(
this is my secod or third day on linux .. iam using staight and havent gone to windwss yet ,lol
i miss that channel
come on quick
always used to tune into it ..
update your /etc/apt/sources.list
feel free to ask anytime
sudo apt-get install real player right
yes
sudo apt-get install realplay
ok mate its done .. installing and stuff now what
let it install mate
whatever i am not registered with freenode.
its done
ok good. now "sudo dpkg -L reaplay" please
did you get output from dpkg ?
i did now what
sudo dpkg -L realplay
i did what you told me now what
so see where is nphelix.so and nphelix.xpt installed ? need those 2 files.
holly shit tahts a lot of files to go through is there a search funtion or something '/
sudo dpkg -L realplay | grep nphelix.so
looking for i know what directories they are at .. now what
did you get hold of nphelix.so ?
i knwo where they are at
now what do i do with them
good. copy them to /usr/lib/mozilla-firefox/plugins with "sudo cp /location/of/nphelix.so /usr/lib/mozilla-firefox/plugins"
done ?
you are missing out something mate.
iam coping the thing wrong or something
use pastebin to paste where your 2 files are nphelix.so and nphelix.xpt
ok ok.. you've already got it.
sudo cp /usr/lib/firefox/plugins/nphelix.so  /usr/lib/mozilla-firefox/plugins/
fine. now restart firefox and see if that BBC music loads up
ok i wil
all good ?
all good mate ? ;)
umm yeah i dont get a an error buuut ..
does it load up or not ?
umm there is not sound it says .. its playing but i cant hear anything
adjust your sound with gnome-volume-manager or type "alsamixer" in the terminal
the windows loads up and what not but i cant hear anything
it works lol
good good.
;) enjoy my friend!
shut your p to p
whatever
daam it .. still is not smooth like whats wrong i have a fast connection ..
don't know about that mate. maybe some other process is hogging your bandwith ?
how can i check
if you liked that channel you would like www.etn.fm and www.di.fm .. enjoy mate
cool.
thanks mate ;) great stuff
anytime at least i could pay you back for yor help :) .. hey dude how can i see whats hogging my bandwith ?
sudo netstat -tupan |less will show you what processes are using the network
could you take a look at my list and tell me if something is up ?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/15985/
lad ill be back
nothing significant is hogging up the network
are you sure in your "/usr/lib/firefox/plugins/", you have both nphelix.so and nphelix.xpt ?
iam back
yeah bothe plug ins are there
